Regulation (verbatim or exact CFR langua: 21 CFR § 886.5925(a): A soft (hydrophilic) contact lens is a device intended to be worn directly against the cornea and adjacent limbal and scleral areas of the eye to correct vision conditions or act as a therapeutic bandage.
21 CFR § 886.5925(b)(1)-(2): Classification—Class II if intended for daily wear only; Class III if intended for extended wear.
21 CFR § 886.5925(c): As of May 28, 1976, a PMA under section 515 of the act is required before a device described in paragraph (b)(2) may be commercially distributed.
21 CFR § 886.1(a): This part sets forth the classification of ophthalmic devices intended for human use that are in commercial distribution.
21 CFR § 801.1(a): The label of a device in package form shall specify conspicuously the name and place of business of the manufacturer, packer, or distributor.
21 CFR § 801.3: Definitions—includes, among others, Automatic identification and data capture (AIDC) and other UDI-related terms.
21 CFR § 801.5: Adequate directions for use means directions under which the layman can use a device safely and for the purposes for which it is intended.
21 CFR § 801.15(a): Required label information must have the prominence and conspicuousness required by section 502(c) of the act.
21 CFR § 801.18(a): Dates on device labels must be presented as YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., 2014-01-02).

21 CFR § 801.109(c)-(d): Prescription devices—labeling in or on the dispensing package shall bear information for use, including indications, hazards, contraindications, side effects, and precautions; any distributed labeling must contain adequate information for such use.
21 CFR § 801.20(a)(1)-(2): The label of every medical device and every device package shall bear a unique device identifier (UDI) meeting this subpart and Part 830.
21 CFR § 801.45(a): A device required to bear a UDI on its label must also bear a permanent UDI marking on the device itself if intended to be used more than once and reprocessed before each use.
21 CFR Part 830 (e.g., § 830.3): Establishes UDI system definitions, including AIDC and other terms used for device identification.
21 CFR § 830.310: GUDID data submission—labeler must provide specified identifying information for each version or model required to bear a UDI.
FDA UDI Compliance Dates: Labels and packages of Class II devices must bear a UDI; dates must follow § 801.18; data must be submitted to GUDID as specified.
21 CFR § 807.81: When a premarket notification submission is required.
21 CFR § 807.87: Information required in a premarket notification (510(k)) submission.
21 CFR § 807.92: Content and format of a 510(k) summary.
21 CFR § 807.97: Misbranding by reference to premarket notification.

21 CFR § 803.50(a): Manufacturer reporting—must report to FDA no later than 30 calendar days after becoming aware of information suggesting a device may have caused or contributed to a death or serious injury, or has malfunctioned as specified.
21 CFR § 803.18(a): User facilities, importers, and manufacturers must establish and maintain MDR event files.
21 CFR Part 806 (§ 806.1): Manufacturers and importers must report certain device corrections and removals and maintain records of all corrections and removals.
21 CFR § 800.10(a)(1): All preparations intended for ophthalmic use, including contact lens solutions, should be sterile.
21 CFR § 800.12: Contact lens solutions and tablets; tamper-resistant packaging requirements.
